description: From Middle English pilkoc, equivalent to an uncertain prefix + cock (“a male chicken; slang term for a penis”). Compare the earlier surname Pylcock etc., as well as pillock, Scots pillie (“a penis”), Jutland regional Danish piller and pillerkok (“a penis”), and regional Norwegian pill (“a penis”).

examples: Al þus eld me for-dede...Y ne mai no more of loue done,Mi pilkoc pisseþ on mi schone...
